definition: pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]

sentences.english: It is evident that the control of Wei's brush functions differently from that of Pollock.
sentences.chinese: 很顯然，魏在運筆上和波洛克是不同的。

sentences.english: Chapter III analysis the role of the texture of the brushwork in the process of aesthetic specifically.
sentences.chinese: 第三章具體分析運筆在審美過程中的作用。

sentences.english: The fourth chapter contains several Reflections about the value of TB in oil painting.
sentences.chinese: 第四章對油畫藝術中運筆價值的幾點思考。

sentences.english: She is evolving with technique and her handling of the brush.
sentences.chinese: 她在技巧和運筆上都有所進步。

sentences.english: The texture of the brushwork is an important means of performance for oil painting in Modeling and language forms.
sentences.chinese: 運筆是油畫造型語言形式美的重要表現手段。

sentences.english: The technique of writing includes two aspects of holding and wielding brush writings.
sentences.chinese: 筆法包括執筆和運筆兩個方面。

definition: the tip of a writing brush/vigor of style in writing/stroke/touch
a transition (stop and change) in spoken sound, music or in brush strokes/a cadence/punctuated by a transition/with syncopated cadence (brush stroke in painting)
vigor of strokes in calligraphy or drawing/vigor of style in literary composition
bold/upright and strong/vigorous/forceful (brush strokes)/sureness of touch
charm or grace (in poetry or art)
